text: UPDATED: APR 23, 2017 Botella 75 cl en Cimmeria 21..04..2017. Color amarillento turbio con espuma blanca. Estilo triple belga más herbaceos y cítricos con buena dosis de carbónico y espuma. Cierto amargo final seco herbaceo fresco y algo citrico. Cuerpo medio de 8 vol con buena sensación alcohólica. Original.

Botella , @Cimmeria , Oviedo 21/04/2017. BBD: 01/17. Color amarillo claro pequeña corona de espuma blanca, aromas herbales, pino sabor intensos a hierbas y cítricos, epeciados carbotacion alta cuerpo medio.

75cl bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 21-04-2017.
BBD: 01-2017.
In short: spicy saison.
Did i enjoy it: why not?.
Pours hazy bright gold with frothy white head. Long head retention, some lacing. Spicy, citrusy, cardamon nose, some subtle tart notes. Medium body, average carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is citrusy, spicy, cardamon, little tart notes. A spicy blonde ale. Good.
Cirka 1984 vintage... ciderish whiskyish in the nose. So alive still. Estery taste, apples for days, clay.. ja tak!

Bottle from the LCBO. Purchased in April 2013, "best before" Dec 2014, opened in April 2017. Pours a nice copper-hued golden colour with a small white head that leaves a touch of lace. Aroma of slightly fermented fruit, light caramel, a touch of spice & herbs (chamomile, cardamon, anise). Flavour is quite sweet and fruity up front - hints of peach and ice wine - drying out a bit in the middle where some tart grape and clove start to come through, and looping back towards sweetness in the finish, with notes of orange candy. A bit of booze warmth in the back as well. Interesting stuff - Id like to try a fresher bottle sometime to see how it compares.

Bouteille avec un BB qui semble être du 08/2021. Robe orangée pâle un peu trouble et surmontée dun col de mousse blanc et très rocailleux. Arômes de liqueur de pomme, orange sucrée, levures belges soignées, miel, épices fraîches, kumquat, raisins blancs. En bouche, levures belges, malt un peu âcre mais rapidement effacé par un goût plus sucré de miel et pomme, léger goût dorange, raisin blanc. Le goût pourrait se comparer à un mousseux léger et sucré. Finale plus mielleuse avec trace dagrumes. Texture mousseuse, forte carbonatation et corps moyen. Très bien.

the aroma of sweet citrus, dry wine, clove, coriander, yeast and some other spices... the taste is fruity and herbal with notes of orange, lemon peel, dry wine, clove, pepper and cardemomme... sweet, bitter and dry aftertaste...

Bottle enjoyed at home
Copper, some haze, big white head. Smell of spicy and fruity yeast esters, clove, cardemomme, pepper, light malts. Light sweet, quite spicy, alot of cardemomme and clove, nice fruity flavors, bone dry. Quite easy drinker, light malts, moderate bitter, spicy tail. Excellent
0.75 l bottle @ Stadin Panimo, Helsinki. Appearance is golden with big head, like champagne. Taste is obviously not hoppy but spicy. Quite dry actually, but still easy to drink. Interesting.

Big white lasting head. Hazy yellow body. Funky wooden tropical fruit aroma with mealy milky caramel notes. Somewhat over-ripe. Dry-sweet resiny milky tropical fruit taste with caramelly notes. Mid-bodied. Fizzy mouthfeel. Dryish fruity herbal aftertaste with wooden spicy notes. Interesting and unusual, but Im not sure how successful it is. (0.75l bottle, from wine monopoly somewhere.)

Had as Posca Rustica. Pours clear golden with a fairly thick eggshell head. Aroma offers pomme, citrus and fresh malt notes. Flavor delivers fruity and malty notes, average but more than palatable. Mouthfeel has decent body and fizz, and an apple finish. Nice all around.

Thanks for suggestion to Sergejs from Alus Celle, 
Pours velvet-yellow with white huge, thick-rocky foam. Aroma is... complex already, notes of flowers, malt/caramel sweetness, coriander, yeasty-friuty esters - just wonderfull. Flavor also is deep and complex with seems even more adjuncts, I even caught some sour notes, but I must re-test this to be sure. Taste is sweet, light bitter with slightly powdery dry finish. Almost full body, thick texture, high carbo. Liked!
Bottle, 750 ml from Svijet Piva. Shared with JFK10000. Pours hazy yellow with average white head. Malty, some fruity notes, spicy, yeasty, moderate sweetness. Creamy, soft carbonation. Medium bodied.

A fairly clear yellow beer with a large, frothy white head. Nose has mildly sour funky notes with citrus, barnyard and pomegranate. Taste is quite dry with a nice ever so mild sourness that leads to a softly bitter finish. Lively carbonation and quite light palate with very well hidden alcohol. Excellently balanxed easy drinking beer.

750 ml bottle @ Stadin panimobaari, Helsinki. Pours clear golden yellow (sedimentary yeast not mixed in) with a white head. The aroma is dominated by sweetish floral notes and hints of acidity. Somewhat sour flavour with floral/fruity esters. The finish is quite sweet. Medium carbonation. A fine example on excellent beer brewed without hops.
A really special beer brewed without hops. Tastes like a spicier than usual tripel. Tried with Jess at Avoli on our anniversary in 2016.

Crystal clear golden body with a small, frothy, off-white, short-lived head that doesnt leave much lacing. Rather strong aroma of generic fruit, pale malt and some spices. Moderate flavour of Belgian yeast, generic fruits and spices. Light sweet and moderate bitter taste. Mid-bodied, dry and moderate carbonation. An ok beer, but I had expected something more special, with more emphasis on the spices. 
[75 cl bottle shared with Svensenga smak & behag]

Refrigerated 75 cl green bottle 2015 corked and capped poured into tulip. Hazy golden with medium white head. Aroma is herbal, medium body, medium carbonation, and medium lacing. Taste is herbal and a little yeasty.
Gyllen farge med mye hvitt brusende skum. Lukter syrlig og samtidig litt krydret. Brusende i munnfølelse. litt krydret og fruktig avslutning.

Hazy orange color with a medium sized, white head that left nice lacing on the glass. Aroma of citrus, herbs, toast, earth, some coriander. Taste of earth, pepper, bitter herbs, moreso than a standard hopped saison. Reminded me of an absinthe.

Bottle at the Aaahhh...Øl!!! Julebord 2015. Hazy light orange body, fluffy white head. Aroma is spicy, crisp malt, mild honey notes. Taste is citric with notes of hay, sweet fruits, grapes. Quite a rich mix which works out pretty good. Pleasant belgian yeast aftertaste. Nice.

25

Bottled May 28th 2015.

Pretty big foamer, 2 fingers with a slow and careful pour. Shrinks slowly and leaves a lot of lacing behind. The beer itself is clear, so far, gold colour.

Smells spicy with some cloves and Coriander, earthy, peculiar bitterness.

Coriander and clove to start. Bitterness is on the spicy side with an overall earthy character and it is yeasty. Not tart but close. It is 8% abv and I do get some warming but no sign in the taste.

Medium body with zesty carbonation that tickles my throat.

Saying that this is yummy wouldnt be out of order. It is a Dupont beer after all.

Wonderful.
Very subtle taste. Some say that its bitter but to be honest no bitterness, amazing taste .

Bottle from Tanakaya shared at a tasting. Herbal nose with corriander and some light spices alongide grassy hops and that classic DuPont yeast aroma. Easy drinking for the abv but a little too sweet. Dry and slightly hoppy finish with more herbal notes. Enjoyable.
Hazy golden amber. Low hopping with interesting herbal nose. Medium heavy body. A bit hoppier in the mouth but slightly too sweet. Funky finish. Ok

COLORE: oro torbido, con lieviti in sospensione. Schiuma bianca, fine, abbondante e persistente. AROMA: decisamente speziato e anche un po da lambic, sentori erbacei. Molto gradevole e interessante. GUSTO: in bocca è molto particolare, molto speziata. Sentori anche di lambic e vinosi. Birra molto particolare, interessante e decisamente dissetante. Da provare.

On tap at Cafe Sara. Clear golden color- ok foam. Medium aroma intensity; fruity, light honey, some pine and nice yeast influence. Medium/ full body & complexity. Good bitterness and balance. Very enjoyable

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Citrus, yeast, spices, good white head quite persistant, deep golden, taste sour and bitter, floral, medium body, medium carbonation...I like this tradition.

clear yellow liquid with frothy white head. aroma of cellar, cider vinegar, paradise apple compotte, dung, toffee. taste has yeast, earthy, medium sweet, light bitter, med sour. med body, creamy feel,average carbonisation, long finish
Golden with small white head. Bit sour aroma. Taste - mix of sour and bitter, remarkable umami notes.

Draught at Stone Liberty Station, San Diego. Clear golden/copper beer with a very small head. Fruity honey aroma, caramel, nectar, grapes, raisins, some plums. Fruity honey flavor, grapes, spicy, citrus, bready, yeast notes. A bit too clean.
Hazy orange with white head. Ripe citrus, yeast and spice. Sweet, thick, oily, alcohol and fruity finish. Overall: enjoyable

Hazy golden amber with big persistent rocky head, cascading streams of bubbles from the bottom of the glass. Aromas of barnyard funk, multigrain bread, apricot, candi sugar, clove and coriander. The taste has ripe stone fruits, lemon zest, fresh bread, a little candi sugar and spices. Nice dry finish and the bit of acidity and high carbonation really ensure there is zero cloying sweetness. Medium bodied. Really well executed belgian golden strong ale style beer.

Golden malty, slight honey on nose. Veeery huskey, dry bready nose, probably what i would hold as a definition of a slight doughy huskey beer. Med bodied, doughy yeast, dry oranges.-- bb

750ml bottle @Stadin panimobaari. 
Pours hazy golden with a thin white head. Yeasty, sweet floral, peachy aroma. Cellary notes. Flavor has sweetness, caramel, Belgian hops, floral notes. Long finish. Tasty.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy light golden body with a large white head. Nose is strong Belgian estery notes; banana, white sugar, red fruits and hints of straw, grains and honey. Taste is white sugar, grains, red fruits, banana and hints of grapes, herbs and straw. Medium body, high carbonation. A nice enough beer, but I dont know exactly what makes this so special and "historical" - to me, this tastes pretty much like any ol Belgian strong ale in the modern tradition. Still nice though.

75cl-flaska från SB. BBD sep-15. Bärnstensfärgad, disig med medelstor skum. Komplex doft med säd, bröd, jäst, blommor, söta päron, alkohol. Smaken går i doftens linje, Maltig, blommig, estrigt aningen vetesyrligt och jästigt. Bra balans, alkoholen bidrar med kryddighet, och värme utan att störa, Lätt pepprig. Riktigt trevlig.
Bottle. Pours clear yellow, big white head. Aroma is floral, spicy, slighrly citrusy. In taste low sweet, spicy, with peachy and citrusy notes. Low bitterness, dry finish.
Big complex nose with yeast, citrus, spices. Hazy orange color. Medium body with a range of tastes, including orange peel, wheat and pepper. Spicy, tangy end. Excellent.
Deep hazy orange color with a medium frothy head on top. Intense orange peel and citrus and cookie nose, lots going on here. Yeasty peppery taste. Highly carbonated, full bodied.

Bottled 750ml. -at Svijet Piva Zagreb. Hazy orange/golden coloured, small white head, mild fruity spicy nose. Moderate malty, fruity, yeasty, spicy and slight alcoholic with pleasant mild spicy finish. Simple but yet very nice and pleasant brew.

Bottle to tulip
Hay, orange, esters, a little barnyard funk, and pepper. Hazy amberish yellow with an off white 1 cm frothy head. Taste is pepper, lemon, hay, wheat, and yeast. Its quite astringent and chalky.

UPDATED: JUN 2, 2015 75cl in teku. Pours a huge, white, frothy and rocky head; light orange to golden colour, cloudy. Smells spicy, yeasty, floral, leaves, sort of "vegetation in spirng", fresh and bit tripel like. Tastes wheat and grainy, malty, fruity/lemon, spicy again, belgian sugary; I would say both medium level sweetness and bitterness, both very smooth and very well blended, very light tartness. Medium+ bodied and creamy; dry finish, with spices and some light hoppiness. A very solid and well made brew, characterized by spices, wheat and obviously the typical yeast. Great balance and drinkability

How: Bottle.
Where: From Systembolaget. Had at a tasting 2015-04-18.
Appearance: Golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Fruit, alcohol, caramel, yeast, sweet malt.
Body: Light to medium body, medium carbonation.
Flavour: Sweet malt, spices, fruit, yeast.

Draft. Perfectly clear light straw hue with a thin, one finger tab of pale white that fizzles away after a few seconds. Pear in the nose, very sweet. Juniper, earthy notes and a hint of biscuits as well. Sweet in flavor. Soil, a little floral sweetness, orange blossom, lavender. A hint of bitterness hits at the swallow. More like a tripel in flavor -- this has a bit more sweetness than your average gruit. Medium body with a soft fizzle of CO2. Delicious but a little sweet. Probably not a traditional gruit, but still mighty tasty.

April 18, 2015. Bottle. Shared by AndySnow, thanks!  Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is spices, grass, orange, grain and light almonds. Taste is light to medium sweet, dry spicy and grassy, light to medium bitter with some bitter orange zest and dry spices in the finish. Light to medium bodied, a bit dry, average carbonation.

Dupont Cervesia 
Bottled in 2013 and released i Sweden april 2014. Best before: september 2015. Ive had this bottle in my beerceelar for one year now.

/Hazy, orange beer with a two finger hig, fluffy head. 

Nose: Tart, lemon, red fruit, orange, citrus, grass, sweet pineapple and pear. 
Taste: Orange, pear, green apple, sweet malt, herbs, spice, hay and grass. 
Body: Medium body with crisp, lively carbonation. Complex, full mouthfeel. Great sweetness and a little bit of bitterness in the dry ending. 

I LOVE this beer!

Bottle 750ml @ yngwie
[Courtesy of yngwie] Pours clear golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, yeast, some fruitiness and hint of banana. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long slighlty warm and dry finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle from ABS drinks, Wilsele. Hazy amber colour, white foam. Medium carbonation. Aroma of caramel, citrus fruit and spices. Light sweet, bitter finish. Also the typical Dupont yeast. Very well balanced. Good!
Bottle from SB. Aroma of yeast, a little like Leffe Blond. Taste like a mix of Belgian ale and pilsener. Very good carbonation! Nice beer!

Bottle from Systembolaget, bought in April 2014. 

Hazy golden with a large white head. Aroma and taste of yeast, citrus, honey and dough. Also some light notes of salt. Failry light body and with some tartness in the finish.
Pours unclear yellow , good white head . Smell is awesome , malty , some funk , bit dry . Taste is dry , bit sweet, malty , some bitterness . Full , nice carbonation and mouthfeel . Pretty good beer
Bottle at Craigs. Pours pale yellow, nose is yeasty, orange, taste is similar, fizzy, sweet.

Couleur du miel avec un col moyen blanc. Larôme terreux et un peu aigre du levure sauvage, un peu du miel, cire dabeille, et un peu du malt léger. Le goût est du miel, levure sauvage, un peu du malt, et tout est très bien équilibré avec un amertume léger dans la finale. Haut carbonatation et léger en bouche.

My research leads me to believe that when ratebeer calls this a traditional ale they mean that this is a Scottish Gruit. Proper glassware is a mug and thats what I had it in.
The appearance was a nice hazy golden orange to yellow color with a one finger white foamy head that dissipated within about less than a minute. The lacing was somewhat spotty and somewhat clingy here and there. 
The smell was sweet herbal, light white wine (but nice). Light citrus fruit amplifies a silky sweet underlying malt.
The taste was herbally sweet with a nice florally silky and somewhat light acceptable white wine balanced by citric fruits. 
On the palate, this one sat about a medium on the body with a nice sessionable quality about it. The carbonation was there - good. I have to say theres a nice smooth sweet herbal quality rolling over my tongue. 
Overall, I like this one and would definitely come back to this.

27/X/14 - 75cl bottle from a trade @ home - BB: IX/2015 (2014-1271) Thanks to hackobock for the trade!
Note: after trying to find this beer for more than 3 years, I eventually acquired it through trade from Scandinavia. Please Belgian brewers, quit this "export only" policy please! Its ridiculous! 
Clear deep orange beer, aery white irregular head, little stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: lots of orange peel, bit sweet, oxidized, bit spicy, coriander. MF: lots of carbon, medium to full body. Taste: bit sourish, refreshing, spicy, bitter, coriander, some oranges, little sweet. Aftertaste: pretty bitter, orange peel, hoppy, banana, yeast, sugary touch, spices, coriander, bit oxidized.

750 ml bottle

An rather unusual experience provides what I can only assume beer might have tasted like long ago. If that was the case Im not sure I would drink quite as much. On the other hand as long as it did not cost upwards of $14.99 like this did I may change my mind. Worth trying once, this unique beer compares favorably to Dogfish Heads own remake of an ancient recipe.

Aroma / Appearance - A bronze body sits below a thin white head despite a strong aggressive pour. Herbs in late spring mix with a dry autumnal feel. Musty books complete a very rustic feel.

Flavor / Palate - Earthy spices and herbs refresh the palate at first. A moderate bite grows over the course of a few sips. A solid finish leaves behind memories of a respectable experiment that is worth sampling once. In general though I believe Id rather purchase the Saison instead if I had to choose one to drink on a regular basis.
From a bottle poured a straw color with a good amount of head. Light malty spicy flavor with a quick finish.
Lasting white frothy head atop a clear, lightly carbonated amber body with minor sediment. Nose of nail polish. Very vibrant and sweet tonic and lemon. Very nicely balanced. Enjoyable.
750 ml bottle. Pours a hazy tawny color with full head. Aromas of light lemon, honey/beeswax, and sourdough. Flavors of herbal/spicy bread, lemongrass, and toasted malts. Interesting.
Dimmig, orange-gul med ett lätt vitt skum. Doft: Malt, jäst, belgo, gräs, banan, jord. Smak: Jäst, belgo, humle, malt, vete?, gräs, lite örter.
Bottle from systembolaget sweden. Thin off white head. A dry woody malty aroma with a small belgian tuch. The taste is a bit sharp and dry.

750 ml bottle purchased at France 44 in Minneapolis. Enjoyed as Dupont Posca Rustica. The pour is slight haze golden with a one inch white head that is lasting. The aroma is grass, soft lemon, and pleasant herbal earthy yeast. The taste is citrus peel, orange fruit, grass and herbal. As it warms there is also a bit of white grape, banana fruit sort of thing going on. The palate is medium bodied, soft carbonation, and bit mouth coating with a lingering herbal finish. Solid.

Golden in colour with a thin but lasting white head, light lacing. The aroma is of oranges, grains, yeast, light spice. The flavour is of lemon citrus, herbal, light spice, fruity. Medium/light body, moderate carbonation. Finishes long, spicy, slightly dry.

Made for the archeological site of Aubechies-Blicquy, with yellowish white, creamy, sticky, rather thin head and orangey peach blonde colour with nice sparkling; aroma of orange, sherry, wheat, hay, apricot and lemon peel; taste fresh citrus with rather sharp carbonation, peachy fruit sweetness, creamy wheatness, full and soft caramelly maltiness, ending in a mildly hoppy finish with lots of yeast and still that dryish carbonation effect. Another great saison by Dupont.

75 cl bottle from SB cons 2014-07-29 Göteborg
AR: wee yeasty, ripe banana, hard bread
AP: copper clear, frothy fizzy lively head
F: soft carbonation, caramel, bready, banana, warming ferling, medium bitternees - lingering, farmhouse yeasty, white peppery, dry, white grapes, white wine, pear cider, wee grainy, great brew
Pours clear gold with large foamy head. Aroma of flowers, grains and grass, some yeast. Taste is lightly sour, belgian and grains. A solid belgian ale.
Mycket trevlig blond öl från Belgien. Fräsch doft av citrus. Något grumlig, fint skum. Lite nötig smak precis som det ska vara. Väldigt bra öl.
Bottled:Eye: Orange with a mid-sized head.Nose: Plums and oranges.Mouth: Medium-bodied.Tongue: Sweet, anise, oranges, alcohol.Brain:Traditional Ale? Tastes like an avarage Belgian Strong Ale to me.
780 ml bottle. Golden with small white head. Aroma of yeast, banana, wheat, herbs and alcohol. Taste is thick, green banana, coriander, hay and alcohol.

@Basunen: trevlig lätt doft och smak med tydliga citrustoner. Något het i eftersmaken. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Hazy golden liquid with medium white head. Aroma of white pepper, bubblegum, earth, bread, light fruit and light flowers. Taste is dry and light to medium bitter with notes of white pepper, bubblegum and perfume. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Nice.
Bottle. Sweet, fruity, cloying yeast. Nice maltiness with notes of dough and cereal. Overall a little too sweet to be as refreshing and drinkable as the other Dupont offerings.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Fruity and herbal smell. Herbal bitter taste with ripe fruit and a belgian yeast character. A bit boozy but besides that nice.

Pours hazy orange amber with medium white head. Aroma of citrus, elderflower, grass, wheat. Taste is sweet, spicy and peppery. Long peppery finish. Body is medium to full and creamy with average carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Smak och doft av humle, aprikos, belgisk jäst, apelsin, citrus, honung, gräs och hö, örter. Fruktig, lagom sötma, välbalanserad, god beska med smak av citrusskal.

Slightly cloudy, straw yellow liquid, big white head that quickly dissipates leaving a long lasting lid. Peppery, phenolic aroma with a little skunk, flowers and lemongrass. The taste is quite refreshing, a bit zesty and slightly vinous. The finish is dry with hints of lingering lemon peal bitterness. Medium carbonation. The mouthfeel is quite wine-like as well in an oily sort of way. Zesty and refreshing sums it up I guess, really nice.

750ml green corked and caked bottle, poured into a Tulip glass. Appearance is cloudy straw colored with a medium sized frothy beige head, that when reduced left no lacing. Aroma of herbs, hay, banana, and lemon peels. Flavour of herbs, spices, lemon peels, wheat bread and a hint of alcohol. Palate is medium bodied, soft texture and average carbonation. Overall a good beer, flavours dominated by herbs and spices, quite similar to a Saison in style.
750 ml bottle nice Belgian taste and aroma a little spicy and peeper undertones not bad

Sample at the Klooster Dupont tasting.
Decent white head. Cloudy golden blond pour. A little pepper in the aftertaste. Nice

2011 bottle, drunk 2012 as "Posca Rustica".Wonderful Dupont pour (I get sick of re-describing the dupont appearance, which is always perfect).Soft herbs in the nose are neither astringent or aggressive and are wedded perfectly with light chocolate, honey and toffee. Esters brighten things, adding citrus, while dry clove and pepper phenols help keep it on the dry side.Ive wanted to try this beer forever and its a bit anticlimactic upon having it, as its just very well-rounded, balanced and quite subtle. Soft malts, fluffy carbonation and a slightly oily texture. Malty, but spicy as well and incredibly wine-like on the finish, thanks to all the herbs and the Dupont yeast. Delicious. Curious to see how this ages. Very reserved for an 8% abv beer.

February 16, 2014. 750mL bottle from LCBO. Straw, lemon, sweet aroma. Golden yellow colour. Touch of sour in both aroma and taste. Farmhouse character, lemony flavours. Nice beer. I do prefer their Saison over this one though.
classico stile belga..birrificio dupont che quasi si replica imitando la bon voeux..meno saison di questultima e più in stile belgian ale
Poured light yellow with a huge, frothy white head. Aroma of spicy sweetness., light citrus. Medium body, flavour is lightly sweet, slightly grainy mouthfeel, lemon zest,
Draft. Tons of licorice and spice in both the nose and flavor. Has earthy tones and a heavy sweetness.

P: A shiny copper orange with a vivacious tornado spinning in the middle of the glass. Topped with a creamy layer of French vanilla colored head that hangs out for a while. Delicate clingy lacing cascaded along the edges. 

S: Green tea tannins, lemongrass, slight skunk aroma, peppery spice, Belgian yeast and burnt sugar. Phenolic presence with subtle bubble gum, cherry syrup and fruit rollups. 

T/M: Herbal infused light fruit cup syrup. Spiced rum soaked apples, flower petals, fresh grass, lime, yellow pear and hard cherry candy. A sugar dosed saison similarity. Moderate body that finishes dry and somewhat chalky. Lingering spiced alcohol. 

O: An interesting brew for sure. Complex and well blended. I have to say the tornado effect was the coolest thing I have ever since pouring a beer. I love the chance to try ancient interpretations of past beers. This was a real treat. Proost!!

750 ml bottle. Pours a veiled pale golden with a thick, creamy, resilient white head. Aroma is lemon, yeast, cake and vanilla. Flavor is sweetbread, orange, lemon, mint, peach and pear. Finish is a nice lemon-lime sting, along with some mint. Medium body, somewhat sticky mouthfeel, with average to strong carbonation. Extremely refreshing and so very easy drinking.
Pours a clear golden with minimal white head. Aroma is spicy some cinnamon. Yeasty. Flavor is slightly sour and slightly bitter. Slightly lemony. Finishes very dry and clean light bodied.
Blonde. Beau collet. Nez: étable/cheval. Foin. Céréale. Fruité. Épicé. Bouche: légèrement acidulé. Mielleuse. Fine amertume. Sucré. Noix. Fruité. Baie de genièvre. Ananas. Poivre. Florale. Très bien.

Thanks to Rogueone for sharing a bottle (as Posca Rustica). This beer pours a clear pale golden color with a medium thick foamy white head that recedes gradually. Patchy lacing on the glass. Aroma of citrus, yeast and grain. Medium-bodied with flavors of grainy malt, earthy yeast and citrus. The finish is floral and earthy with a fruity yeast aftertaste. Above average overall.
Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Light fruity aroma with a hint of alcohol. Light flavor with notes of wheat, fruits, light spice and a touch of yeast. Sweet and fruity finish.
Bottle sampled at a tasting event. From notes. Herbal and citrus with a decent malt backbone. Pretty darn good.

Bottle, under the label Posca Rustica, shared with Grippitis, Parksy, and a few others. Golden body, average white head. Sweet grainy aroma, some yeast, tinned pineapple. The palate is much the same-- grainy, perhaps even a touch corny, sweet pineapple juice. No "herbs and spices" as advertised, just quite a dull, simplistic golden ale. Not impressed.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Typically Dupont, with a fine and complex nose dominated by the profile of the brewerys yeast; spicy and warm. A minor classic in the Dupont catalogue.

Bottle, caged and corked, under the "Posca Rustica" label. Nice classic visuals, golden orange and light, slightly opaque. The aroma is darn like pineapple juice, straight up. This drinks with a nice fruity essence, overall -- a definite tropical fruit tilt being the primary component. Very evenly balanced, with any herbal aspects being intertwined quite well. Fun. (#5334, 11/17/2013)
On tap shared at Bakujun, a very solid golden colored Saison. Spicy Saison aroma, fill mouthfeel , tasty Saison goodness, very solid.

Poured a hazy light orange color with a large white head. Aroma is very nice with lots of fruit and yeast. Slightly tart with oranges. Taste is fruity with a fair amount of tart yeast notes. Lots of carbonation and alcohol is slightly noticeable. Slightly creamy texture with some nice hops to balance things out. Overall very good.

Bottle - 750ml. Beautiful cloudy golden body with a huge, lasting white foamy head. Fresh hoppy aroma with malty, herbal, and citrusy hints. Alcohol is well hidden. Its sharp hoppy taste carries coriander and candy sugar notes. Ends with a long, robust bitter/sour finish. Definitely meets my expectations!

Bière superbe que cette recette de larchéosite dAubechies qui nous surprend à plus dun
titre, mais on pouvait sattendre à des merveilles avec cette magnifique brasserie Dupont.
Le côté herbes aromatiques a été développé dans lesprit strictement gustatif, et non pas 
fausse antiquité que dautres sites auraient pu exploiter. Bravo à Aubechies Blicquy dêtre
resté au côté original dune bière belge spéciale, ce quelle devait être, mais il fallait éviter
tous les écueils faciles de ce genre historique, et même ici antique ... Bravo encore.
Donc par rapport au site Ratebeer, insistons sur le fait que cette bière nest pas une « traditional
ale », mais une « spéciale belge » (ou « spéciale ancien belge » si vous préférez!!!).
Les artistes de chez Dupont nous ont sur cette base concocté (cest le mot!!!) un merveilleux breuvage gaulois aromatique.
Bouteille de 75 cl, bouchonnée de liège, à létiquette sobre (comme toujours chez Dupont).
Couleur doré foncé brillant. 
Clarté nette, pure.
Bulles moyennes par milliers partout (mais quand on a entendu lexplosion à louverture
de cette bouteille, rien détonnant....).
Mousse blanc/beige bien formée : floconnée en bas et crémeuse en haut au centre.
Arômes de pain gris, levure, foie de veau, pointe de muscade, croûte de pain.
1ère bouche soyeuse à lentrée très originale, sur des épices orientales fines, fleurs et herbes,
suivies dun malt caramel. Arrière-bouche bien pleine, complète avec une pointe désaltérante
dherbes.
2ème bouche dun fantastique ensemble céréales/houblon/levure, avec une pointe dépices fines.
3ème bouche fleurie sublime, avec une pointe de lavande, de santal et daubépine.
Arrière-bouche très pleine et qui progresse.
Longueur (avec une bouteille très légèrement réfrigérée, comme conseillé par le brasseur)
sublime, avec des fleurs en tous sens et lorge qui revient, à la texture très moelleuse.
Levure douce, veloutée, avec une pointe de sel marin et de poivre.
Alcool très bien, qui donne un soutien massif à cette bière.
Finale magique, splendide, grandiose.
Conclusion : une réussite totale, dans un format qui a fait ses preuves, et qui apporte à notre
boisson nationale un attrait considérable, voire extrême quand elle atteint ces sommets...

2012 edition: Yellow gold. Ornate white crown of uniform foam. Riveting nose of potpourri, apricot puree, tangerine, flowery hops (Russian sage, honeysuckle), assorted peppercorns, toasted piecrust, vanilla cream, putty, sugar cookie. Plenty of the signature Dupont sulfur, as well, along with some gunpowder and white pepper. Soft, natural carbonation. Highly vivacious, initially, with Duponts telltale peppery phenolic sass and sparkle quelled by a slippery wheat-induced twang and a splash of floral hops reminiscent of lilac and honeysuckle. Fruity esters are profuse, slathering gently sweet dried-pineapple, explosive peach, and supple apricot jam atop a firm and well-structured malt foundation. Considering its understated presence and buoyancy, the malt shows astounding detail and textural depth as well as some cakey girth. Never at all cloying, however. Attenuation is flawless, cleansing the palate and briefly displacing the residuals to allow the crisper malt definition to vividly exude. Vanilla cream and mashed banana softness tempers the persistent pepperiness.  Finishes sharply herbaceous yet profoundly soft, nuanced, and moist with Juicy Fruit gum, subdued sulfury phenolics and sweetish honey-soaked malt. Mmmm, so beautiful and, remarkably, so effortlessly quaffable despite the abv. The balance is exemplary, which is quite the accomplishment considering the copious amounts of spices and herbs used in creating this.  Another masterpiece to add to Duponts lengthy list of crowning achievements.

text: Light gold with a moderate haze - minimal lace, constructed of large, loose bubbles - nose is moderately honey-sweet, with some earthy/musty character from the yeast, along with some subtle but complex aromas of lavender, dandelion, pepper - body is light and lively, but the carbonation is both sturdy and creamy, giving this a nice body - a light mineral note throughout - surprisingly delicate for the abv, which does not show at all, by the way - flavor is lightly tart/sour, but with a wonderful light pale malt sweetness to balance - light peppery notes, some gum and banana esters, some lavender and chamomile - quite a bit of fennel as it opens up - a bit of a warming spice in the finish - started at around a 3.4 for me, but as it warmed and opened up, I really started to love it - wonderfully subtle and feels lovely on the palate.

Ive been looking for this beer for a long time.  And its a real surprise!  The aroma uopon opening the bottle is a strong earthy, almost manure like smell.  Upon smelling it out of the glass, the earth and manure are still there, just tamped down a bit, along with lemon, lemon peel, pepper.  The flavor was the same, strong manure/earth, lemon, lemon zest, pepper.  After a minute, the earthy/manure thing substantially subsided, and the beer was mostly lemon, pepper, funk.  Weird.  The appearance is an odd yellow/orange, white head, bubbly and hazy, like champagne.  The finish is mostly peppery, lemon peel.  Medium in body, odd sort of oily mouthfeel.  Crazy beer.  But Im a big fan of these reproductions of ancient ales.  Glad I got a chance to try this.

Bottle labeled Posca Rustica. Pours cloudy dark golden color with white head. Smells like a Dupont beer with some extra spices. Characteristic Dupont yeast flavor with some spices. Light to medium body with lively carbonation.
Gedronken bij benzai, samen met dutchdrebus. Geel klein beetje oranje van kleur. Fruitig, bitter, zoet.
A very silky smooth cross between a hefeweizen and a Belgian Wit. Pours a lovely orange yellow color. Some vanilla notes as well. And boy is the alcohol present.

Posca Rustica.  Hazy golden and not much head.  This has a lot of spicy up front on the nose, along with Dupont yeast.  Some malts up front as are a bit sticky, but there is also a lot of spice on the palate.  It dries out quite a bit in the finish with all the spice and alcohols.  Good, maybe not their best work, but good.

750 ml bottle.  Cloudy yellow Orange, frothy off white head.  Nice funky dry straw aroma.  Flavor is much sweeter, cookie dough, grass, yeasty, herbal, lightly spicy. A nice beer, not duponts best though.

750ml from Knightly. Clear golden, large, foamy head, no lacing. Aroma is really nice and straightforward, like a pils with blooming continental hops, water flowing over mineral-rich rocks, pandan leaf, and a little grain alcohol spilled over a spring lawn. Soft palate. Scrumptiously balanced, dry, clean, and grassy with no low notes. The strength actually works here. Hitting the spot!

75cl bottle @ home shared with Dutchdrebus and Ansjelaah. Hazy yellow color with slight yeast particles in it, average sized white head. Smell banana and a lot of herbs or spices. Taste is less bad, but still not very good. A bit speculaas, herbs, spices, malts. Medium body, low to medium carbo.

Bottle @ benzai. Hazy yellow colour with a big white head. Smells like a weizener, banana, malts, some hops, horse blanket and herbs. Tastes herbs, malts, weird and not like something i like. Good carbo, medium body.
Has a horribly skunky aroma, but the flavor is fantastic.  Spicy, flavorful, malty, sweet, and complex.  Yum.

Pours a hazy pale yellow with a medium white head.  Aroma has some herbal grassiness and spice.  Flavor follows suit...notably spicy...pepper...herbal.  mouthfeel is light/medium and lively with a dry spicy/herbal finish.

180412: Bottle @ DØE Aarhus Syd Meeting. Violent pressure in the bottle, cork of the flew by itself. There was high co2 in the beer but not as much as you might expect after opening. weakly champagne foam and texture. Works easily, despite the high alcohol strength. burp water. slightly sharp aftertaste.

Very very tasty. It pours hazy orange with a small white head. The aroma has some Belgian yeast and a bit of spice. a bit of lemon and some sweeter fruit. The flavor follows suit with a nice sweetness balanced by a little pepper. Finishes quite dry and refreshing.

Tallahassee, Fl - New Leaf Market  - cage corked 750 ml bottle.  Pours a murky dark golden with a fluffy white head that dissipates rather quickly. Aroma is sweet and yeasty with some white grape notes, a hint of sweet cake mix and molasses.   Full bodied flavor with some dates, bubble gum, a dollop of yeastiness and some white grape juice. Sticky, thick mouthfeel. Decent.

Bottle @ DØE meeting. Pours light yellow with fluffy white head. Aroma of malt, belgian yeast, grapes,oak, light tart notes. Taste is malty, yeast, caramel, little sugar sweetness, oak, grapes, grass. Thn to medium body, lively carbonation.180412

On tap at Toronado.  Hazy golden color with a nice white head.  Yeasty and herbal aroma with spice and some hay.  Pale malt base with herbs - maybe oregano? - and some earthy notes.  Medium-bodied with above average carbonation and a tingly mouthfeel.  Good but not really my style.
On tap at Toronado. Pours blonde with an off-white head and a fruity aroma. I dont usually like gruit, but this one is very nice. Just the right amount of bitterness and a refreshing malt flavor.

4/16/12. 750mL bottle labeled "Posca Rustica." Hazy orange pour with a nice, fluffy off-white head that sticks and laces plenty. Funky, floral, and yeasty aroma with touches of tartness and some sort of spice that reminds me of cumin. Refreshing flavor that is less tart than the aroma leads on, but with nice funkiness, sweet floral aspects, and some residual sweetness, surprisingly. Tasty.

2011 bottle. Pours a slightly hazy deep gold with foamy white head that fades to a ring. Aroma is grainy malts, bread, hints of citrus, some spice character and hay. Pale malts upon the entry quickly drying up into some cheese and earthiness with spices finishing out the beer. Solid mouth feel and some noticeable alochol notes in the end. Overall its pretty rustic (name implies) and tasty for a warm Florida night.

My bottle [750ml] shared with HogTownHarry, JoeMcPhee, jerc & mabel -- c/o Glouglouburp. Feb. 11. Pours a cloudy golden-peach with an average size diminishing frothy white head. Aroma is sweet, herbal and lightly hoppy along with yeast and a hint of alcohol. Flavour is yeasty and herbal along with light hops and a lightly bitter, lightly spicy finish. Medium bodied. Quite nice, I liked it.

Whole Foods P St DC 750 ($12): Pours a slightly hazy yellow/orange with a white head. Aroma is of Earthiness, le funk, kind of skunkiness, yeast, and fruit. Taste is on the sweet side. There is a whole lot of earthiness, a wee bit of astringency, and some ambiguous uncut funk. Good mouthfeel. Alcohol is completely covered. Also a few dry notes are extant. I would have no idea I am drinking an 8 percenter. Leaves your mouth feeling dry and a bit parched. Loads of herbs. A solid beer. I would say this is weird, but I am a bit jaded.
Davvero una birra fantastica! Si presenta discretamente, ottimo aroma, floreale  e fruttato, sapore molto particolare, dolce che si accosta in parte a una tripla! Retrogusto persistente e dolce!

[4295-20120211] 750mL bottle. Floral old fruit cider aroma. Slightly hazy, orange body with a small long-lasting foamy white head and some small floaties. Yeasty applesauce flavour has a lingering raisin sweetness. Medium body. Not overly pleasant. (6/3/6/2/12) 2.9
(c/o blankboy, w/ him, HogTownHarry, jerc, JoeMcPhee)

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2012 2012-02-11. Hazy golden body with a small white head. 3+ Lightly fruity-cidery character, pale cereally malt, sweet finish. 7+ Light alcohol in the aroma, sweet pale malt. 7+ Smooth average plus bodied palate. Bit simplistic, but quite quaffable and pleasant. Bottle shared by Blankboy

I figured this was a saison since Dupont made it, but Ancient Herbed Ale sounds nice too. Poured into a tulip.

4.0 A: Deeply hazed brown-tinted orange color. Three fingers of foamy white head. Retention is very good and a good sized ring of lacing is left.

4.0 S: Herbalness abounds in the earthiest of ways. Hay and something like honey. The herbal assault is lead by jasmine and lemongrass, which may or may not even be in here. Wild apple and rotting wood funkiness. Some peppery spiciness from the yeast and maybe a touch of banana fruitiness. 

4.0 T: Banana comes to the forefront in the taste. Herbal and funky. Apple orchard, light woodiness, wet hay and grass, lemongrass, jasmine, sage. Moderate bitterness that has to come partially from the herbs. Peppery yeastiness. Bits of honey, some breadiness, lightly phenolic.

3.5 M: Light to ligher medium body. Carbonation is moderately spritzy to the point of almost being biting. Moderately creamy for the body.

4.0 D: Overall, quite enjoyable. I havent had a lot of this style, so its tough to judge how it compares to competitors, but Ill have no problem finishing off this 750.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 02-08-2012 01:46:35

UPDATED: DEC 6, 2012 draft at pizza paradiso dupont circle in DC.  hazed but shimmering bright gold body. mild to medium pepperiness and spice character, moderately tart, mildly musty and doughy.  as it blossoms when warming the low sweetness of Belgian pale malt grows and the yeast provides a hearty mustiness, while the body remains incredibly smooth and soft, fantastically delicate and frothy.  floral potpourri esters and spice additions give a bit of a bath soap resemblance, but its not overdone or dominant next to the malt and yeast. restrained and delicate.

On tap at small bar. Pours a clear gold  with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma is very perfumey with flora, light fruits and sweet grains. Flavor starts with sweet grains and has light fruit and perfume notes in the finish.
Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity and yeasty. Flavor is quite sweet and light bitter. Sweet finish with warming alcohol. 090212
Bottle. Nice head with excellent duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are flowers, citrus, malt, grain, stroke of honey and hops.
Bottle. Clear golden with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, yeast, fruit and notes of alcohol. Flavour is malt, yeast, spices, little sweet, hops, herbs, little sweet and a little honey.

Bottle. Hazy yellow-straw coloured body with a large white head. Aroma: bread, floral-herbal with a flavour of mint, nettles, biscuit, honey and alcohol. Sweetish body with a bitter finish. Medium mouthfeel.

Bottle picked up at Whole Foods P Street in DC a few months back. Served in a Mikasa tulip.

Pours a semi-hazed very light golden color with a nice white head that fades somewhat quickly into a thin cap throughout. The nose brings forward some wheat and a bit of light spice. Slight clove character. Flavor has a good dosing of wheat and grain plus moderate spice. Smooth and slightly chewy with moderate carbonation. Dry, fairly-bitter finish. Quite nice.
Super light yellow. Small white head. Gamey front with honey-sweet malts. Lightly spiced. Faint herbal notes. Bitter finish. A proto-Saison.

Bottled at Pressklubben, Stockholm.  Hazy deep golden, small head. Fruity honey aroma. Sweet, near full bodied with rounded, lightly spritzy mouthfeel. Salty with notes of bubblegum and viola. Vinous with mead-like honey. Tarter finish with slight salty bitterness.

Described as a Herbed/Spiced Beer on beerAdvocate, Im not really sure what to expect.  But of all the beers on the Holiday offering list, this is one of the few with a very good review/score on Advocate. So, we bought a case, and well just have to crack a bottle to see what weve got.

First off, the backside of the label tells this lengthy story about how the Posca Rustica came to be. I tried to read it all it one sitting, but had to come back to it in the morning. In any case, they weave a tale of a spiced version of a saison ale that was fed to the Roman soldiers while stationed in modern-day Belgium.

Posca Rustica pours out a darker amber color than the standard Saison.  Theres a significant rusty shade to the amber color, with a nice white fluffy foam on top.  The foam is thick and long-lasting, leaving a nice amount of lacing behind. The aromas are a beautiful melting pot of bready, yeasty-ness, but much less funky than a typical saison. The herbal components are evident, but not intense.

The herbal aromas follow through on the palate, which is really cool. In body, its fairly light like the saison, but  its got a much creamier, velvety mouth-feel. Its got this added layer of complexity that is as much about texture as it is flavor. Right about now, Im wishing I had ordered more than just this one case.
Shared with JoeMcPhee. Cloudy yellow colour with a frothy white head. Lively carbonation. Citrus herb aroma. Thin texture. Apple flavour. Fairly sour.

750 c&c as Posca Rustica from The Davis Beer Shoppe in Davis, CA. Pours hazy orange tinged gold with a creamy white head. Champagne bubbles! Aroma is earthy and lightly fruity and herbal. Theres a touch of Wit like spice - but maybe thats herb? Med + body. Frothy carb. Flavor is earth, herb and fruit. Its definitely on the dry side; lightly astringent. Theres a stab of light fruit in the finish. This is very good ale.

Pale orange with white head.  Sweet herbal pastry aroma with a hint of alcohol.  Mildly sweet vanilla toffee apricot with lingering herbal bitterness.   Very similar to an herbal Saison Dupont.  Very nice, but Im not really into herbal beers.   DuPont is in a bind because Saison Dupont and Avec Les Bons Veoux simply cannot be improved upon.

750ml bottle, honey gold color, with a frothy pillowy white head, yeasty fruity nose of green apples and pears, tropical fruits with a light honeyed pale, toasted, wheat malt note, and some faint herbal floral hop spicy accents in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a nice sweet honeyish pale, wheat, toasted, caramel malt, yeasty stewed green apple, pear fruity character with some faint acidic green apple skin, lemon peel, honey lollipop candyish flavours, with some spiced herbal flowery hop undertones, leading towards a warming, sweet honeyish wheaten maltiness, apple skin fruitiness, lingering subtle dry hoppiness finish.

Always good to try a new Dupont beer, and this one was an interesting variation on their usual offerings. A semi-cloudy pale orange pour with a grainy sandstone head and decent lacing. Nose was moderately tart and herbal, with some spice and pepper along with yeast and a touch of funk (maybe even some hops in there too). Nice mouthfeel, lightly prickly with a touch of acetic-ness on the palate. Taste is squarely in the ripe apple and yeast zone, with dry spice and hops in the finish. Pretty good stuff.

UPDATED: FEB 11, 2012 Deep golden pour with a very thick white head. The aroma has a little bit of white pepper and a little bit of very herbal hop aroma and flavour. A little bit of bright fruit and a touch of clove. There is a really great balance of spice and lean malt. A little bit of light citrus over a very dry Duvel-esque flavour along with a little bit of light mint and a floral sort of flavour. Its a lovely brew.

Beer from Rare Beer Club: pours cloudy golden,huge fluffy white head. Smells herbal and fresh, vanilla, spearmint, citrus, bread, bubblegum. once on your palate, esters, grainy, honey suckle, creamy with mineral notes. not quite up to par to other Duponts, but still really nice.

750, corked and baled. Pours a hazy medium golden amber with a lively, fizzy mousse on top. Spicy bright nose showing lots of white pepper, grass, hay, and some light minerally funk. Creamy medium body with lively carb. White pepper, grass, hay, floral notes combine with a bit of slightly basementy minerally funk on the mid palate. Finish is a fantastic combination of mineral dryness along with some peppery phenol. Great stuff.

75cl bottle. Light golden/yellow with a big white bubbly head. Nose : Very citrus with spicy aromas. Yeast notes reminds of a white beer. Humid laundry smell with some little alcohol. Caramel. Sip : Creamy and a bit watery with aggressive carbonation. Sweet with sour/dry continuation. A little bitter end. The aftertaste rest in the dry/sour area. The beer reminds of a white but the alcohol is warming and goes straight in the head so careful. Good one anyway.

750 ml. Labeled as Posca Rustica. Light golden body with a frothy, white head, fully lasting. The first sniff tells you this is a Dupont beer, the initial aroma very much like a Dupont Saison. Notes of toasted grain, fruits, lemon, citrus, earthiness, apple peel, herbs and grass. A hint of clove. The flavor is moderately sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. It finishes lightly to moderately sweet and lightly to moderately bitter. Medium body, velvety texture and lively carbonation. Complex beer with a classic dry finish that leaves tastes of melon and tart citrus. Highly drinkable though it is slightly alcoholic. Too bad its not in the 6% range.

750ml Bottle (As Posca Rustica):  Aroma of malt, yeast, grain, and coriander.  
Poured golden/amber in color with a large, creamy, dense, off-white head that diminished but lasted throughout.  Cloudy.  Very sparkling.  Full of tiny and small-sized particles throughout.  Good lacing.  Flavor is lightly sweet and slightly bitter.  Tastes of malt, yeast, coriander, slight fruit, a hint of alcohol, grains, hops, and barley.  Light to medium body.  Tingly, then dry texture.  Lively carbonation.  Malt, yeast, coriander, hop, grain finish is very dry.  8%ABV is a bit noticeable in the flavor though by no means hot.

Bottle thanks to Dany.  Aroma is skunky (unfortunately), peppery, some tropical fruits and soap. Taste: Much better. Yeast, pineapples, mango. Palate: Ver light bodied, prickly effervescence. Overall: Worst beer Ive had from Dupont, which is better still better than average.

Bottle...  Poured a coppery orange.  Tasted of highly attenuated, drying yeast characters.  Not a whole lot going on with the herbs as I really only got the yeast spiciness.  Some fruity esters and malt sweetness.

Had as Posca Rustica .. . Pours a dirty gold .. . shaving cream bubbly foam .. . light notes of yeast, honey, bee butt, and light spices .. . tingling mouth, pretty simple .. . an alright brew, but Duponts regular lineup is better .. . . Not many people know this, but I owned the first radio in Springfield. Not much on the air then, just Edison reciting the alphabet over and over. A hed say. Then B. C would usually follow...
Tangerine and clove is the taste.. Very unique.  Pineapple juice aroma.  Bright and triple like upfront... Finish is dough and clove not dry.
Draft at rattle. Pours a deep orange amber with white lacing. aroma is sweet plain malts. Mouthfeel is  thin with notes of malt, light fruit. Dang.

Draft at Gingerman before the Furthur show. A great Belgian ale, with flavors and aromas based on the Dupont yeast strain. Bananas, clove, pepper, dough. The finish is dry with a slight alcohol present. Nicely balanced and very sophisticated.
En botella.color dorado turbio.poco encaje.aromas azucar y levadura.un poco alcoholica.especiada.amable

2010 bottle. Clear golden fizzy body with a rocky white head. Great strong yeasty aroma with orange and spices. Balanced bittersweet flavour with yeast, spices, a hint of orange and a dry finish. Great.

(Bottle, 0.75 l - BBE 02/2013, 20111104) The beer poured pale golden and hazy. Its head was white and dense. Aroma had honey, fruitiness, spices and Belgian style yeast. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, hops, Belgian style yeast, malts, spiced and bitterness. Aftertaste was fruity and bitter. Interesting and unbalanced but nevertheless nice.
Clear yellow with almost no head. Sweet fruit malt and grain aroma and taste with apple and honey notes to the finish and a smooth palate.

750 ml corked and caged bottle poured a hazy gold with a lasting white head. Aromas of straw, barnyard, pear, pineapple, yeast and spice. Palate was light bodied and crisp with a dry finish. Flavors of straw, barnyard funk, pear, lightpineapple, light yeast and light spice with a crisp dry finish.

Sampled at the DC Ratebeer gathering.  750ml bottle pours a transparent gold with an active, white head.  Nose is herbal, spices, coriander, light grass, light lemon.  Flavor is sweet, candy sugar, a little pepper, some ginger, a little orange, coriander, herbs.  Full bodied, spicy, peppery finish.

Appearance: deep hazed gold with brazen highlights, with a fluffy, sticky, creamy white head and lots of residual lace.   Aroma: very yeasty, with honeyed citrus aromas, with pear, grains, hay, gass, and herbal notes.   Taste: slightly spicy notes of herb garden, over substantial honeyed sweetness, a blast of yeast; very floral as well.   Finish: creamy, with the yeastiness yielding to a wheaty tartness, with a hint of sweet barnyard funk.   Notes: A sweet, spicy, floral, herbal, complex beer.  Like a saison meets a belgian blonde meets I dont know what.  Pretty enjoyable.  Palate was creamy, yet effervescent; slick but refreshing.  Bottle from the Rare Beer Club.

750 bottle, Posca Rustica label, courtesy of GT2. Pours a hazy straw color with a medium frothy offwhite head. Decent head retention. Tart vinous aroma with earthy and grape notes. The taste is citrus, stone fruits, caramel, vinous notes. Medium bodied. Nice beer.

Clear straw pour with a huge white head. Tart herbal notes, lemon, roasemary, orangepeel, and a huge dough presence give way to both tropical and nectar fruits, more dough proliferation, and a hint of booze.

Bottle as Posca Rustica: pours a clear pale golden with a spotty lacing white head. Has a light biscuity malty nose with some floral hops and a touch of lavender with some light fruity esters.  Starts with a good fullness and sweet bready malts with a clean fresh bitterness and light fruitiness before a drier finish.  True to style and enjoyable.

Bottle shared by GT2.  Pours clear gold with a large, fizzy and frothy white head, medium retention with light lacing.  Aroma is bright Noble hops, farmhouse yeast, light esters, and light straw malt.  Flavor is light malt, medium hops and esters, light bitterness, light to medium farmhouse yeast with a dry finish.  Medium body and carbonation, low warmth.
Bottle, cloudy orange golden color with long lasting bright foam, aroma is good grainy yeasty herbs, flavor is grainy also with cream of wheat, potpourri, floral notes, good bitter finish
In bottiglia al Duca, e poi da ilbeershop.it; mai avrei detto che fossero 8% abv., si sente molto il tocco Dupont. Secondo me un pochino di luppolo cè..

750 ml bottle a orange colored beer with a white head aroma malts spicy coriander mint fruits yeast and hops flavor mats coriander mint fruits citrus yeast and hops

750 ml bottle from Premier Wine and Spirits (Halifax).  Pours a hazy golden colour with large white head and lots of bubbles.  Aroma full of yeast with some apple/pear and light spice.  Taste also has the fruity esters and spice, as well as some hay.  Active carbonation.  Good.

(750ml bottle)  Pours a lightly cloudy yellow body with a moderate white head.  Aroma of florals, nuts, yeast, light citrus, and pepper.  Flavor of florals, grass, grains of paradise, earth, yeast, clove, herbal, and pepper with a dry finish.

Clear blonde with a medium white head. Intense aromas in the range of Dupont saisons but with a spicier touch (sweet gale, coriander, nutmeg). The noble poperinge hops comes trough nicely as well as a mineral touch
that reminds me of Poperings Hommel beer.
Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, everything that emerged on the nose is showing in the palate. Another really well crafted Dupont beer. Excellent.

Bottle picked up at SL.... Nice glowing orange pour, good head. Aroma of some apples, fruit, spices, flowers. Taste is fruitier then expected... Dry, some spices, light flowers but lots of fruits. Lots of carbonation. Easy to drink. Overall, not what I was expecting but very enjoyable. Good beer

Bouteille verte de 750 ml, avec bouchon de liège, obtenue via Importations Privées Bièropholie. Arôme: Odeur de citron avec une pointe de levures et de pommes vertes. Apparence: La couleur est blonde légèrement voilée avec une moyenne densité de bulle. Présence dun mince col mousseux et dune fine dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de pommes légèrement sucrées avec une pointe de citrons et de céréales. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture légèrement onctueuse. Forte effervescence en bouche. (Rating #3759)

750ml corked bottle. Champagne pop when the cork comes out. Hazy golden pour with a tight bubble head that leaves lots of lace. Lots of funk on the nose. Candied fruit, hay and a certain medicinal quality. Fruity on the palate with some fresh hay and a crisp almost tart finish. Light and refreshing on the palate with lots of carbonation dancing on the tongue.
Very interesting and different brew.

A golden straw colored pour. Starts off with a huge white head. This quickly fades away, leaving not much in the way of lacing behind it. Just a thin layer of bubbles keep afloat the surface. Honey and malt aromas are the first thing to greet my nose. There is a bit of spiciness to it as well. Without actually having spices. The taste is pretty much on par with the aroma. Sweet and silky smooth. A honey-like coating envelopes my mouth. There is a slight bitterness in the aftertaste. This beer is awesome. I could, and will, drink it daily. My new favorite, until the next one comes.

750ml bottle from IPB.

Appearance : Clear yellow with big white fluffy head. Nice foamy head.

Aroma : Awesome yeast with light funk.

Taste : Nice light funk with lots of yeast. Quite clean. Light tartness on finish.

Overall : Soft carbonation. Mainly yeast and light spices. Nice light funk. Carbonation could be a tad fizzier. Still nice beer.

This poured a darker yellow color with a white head. Aroma was of sourdough bread,. some lemons and yeast, very odd combination. Flavor was almost tart apple juice, some yeast and bread and light bitteringhops. Very unique stuff, I liked this one.

Bottle from the museum it was brewed for.  Shared with MrChopin plus 2.  Cloudy yellow color, thick white head, solid lacing.  Aroma of rising rye bread dough.  Taste is rye bread, hay, straw with a sour finish.  Interesting.

Bottle. Hazy peach golden with a thick white head. Aroma is floral and herbal with pale malt. Flavor is sweet malt, yeast, brown sugar and floral notes. Medium to full body with a creamy mouthfeel and average carbonation. Not the best from this great brewery.

75cl bottle, RBSG grand tasting, thanks Joel.  Small white head, clear apple juice body.  Aroma is medium sweet, straw, melon, light flower.  Taste is moderately sweet, straw, apple, light biscuit.  Effervescent medium body.

Bottle, 75cl corked. A finger-thick, dense, off-white head sits on top of a golden, almost clear body. The aroma has a spiced and herbal start, something reminiscent of bog myrtle. Some sugar and a generic fruityness too. Fruity, slightly sugary and pleasantly herbal flavor with a little bitterness. Smooth, yet over carbonated, slightly warming. Bitter and fruity in the end. A nice and unusual beer. 110204
transparent gold, thin white ring. Dandelion, grass, bit husky, lightly sugary with pepper and grass, light perfume, citrus and earth through. Very nice if a bit sweet.

Thanks to Noodleuser for this one at RBSG. Pours out a cloudy golden/straw color with a moderate off white head. Aroma is fruity with some apple and pear, and a light earthy touch. Taste is very clean, some yeasty fruits, apple, pear, some light spices also.

750mL. Pours a clear, straw almost witbier SRM with a healthy, pillowy, white head. Excellent retention and giant lace. Dupont yeast nose with mild celery, zippy citrus, fresh lemon and lime, no candi sugar nonsense. Fresh apple and pear in the nose. Taste is sweeter, apple forward, lightly tart and effervescent like a good cider. Gets a little sugar. A little apple heavy and cidery for me but still very nice.
Bottle at RBSG. Pours cloudy gold. White head. Nose/taste of pear, lemon zest, honey, red grapes, perfume-like hops and yeast. Some florals in the nose. Lightly dry finish. Excellent.
Light and vinous nose, lots of golden fruits, some honey and pears, light hay. The taste is dry and lightly bitter, lots of perfumy hops, some light honey, lots of apple skins and grassy hops.

75cl bottle. Pours cloudy orangish with a bubblt white head. Aroma is nice and complex: prominent yeasts with a decise fruitiness, some honey-caramel notes along with some hoppiness. Taste is quite complex: starts a bit sweet and fruity with yeast and grass, then hoppy notes to end with spices. Almost dry finish. Nice complexity, full bodied and high carbonation. Really nice.

Bottle. Easy out cork and a big pop. Big head on well carbonated hazy gold. Big familiar scent; Belgian yeast, peach and apricot. Initial impression is dusty, boozy fruit. Overall contains all those notes. A dusty Belgian Maibock.

Bottle 750ml. Great beer. Aromas of citrus, caramel, coriander, vanilla, and dough. Taste is sweet, with a hint of sourness. Palate is almost creamy, and full bodied. Amber, cloudy, with a frothy white head.
Bottle. Golden colour with a white head. Aroma is fruit, yeast, grass, hop. Flavour is fruit, malt, yeast, hop, grass, spices, citrus. Nice beer

750 ml bottle. Pale golden body with a huge white head. Quite mild aroma, fruity, citric, spicy and a hint of caramel. Flavor is sweet, mild malty, hint of caramel and spicy fruity. A bit unusually, complex and very nice.

draft @ Moeder Lambic.

Sampled from the tap, July 2010 at Chez Moeder Lambic Fontainas
The beer arrives with a one-finger thick, creamy, off-white colored head, while the beer is a hazed, pale gold / yellow color.  The aroma is herbal and hop like up front (even if it is gruit derived), and has a pale, hay-like grain character to it.  The nose reminds me of the scent of orange blossoms, sweet clove in the finish, grassy coriander and that Dupont yeast mustiness.  There is certainly a very herbal, hop-like character to this note.

Sweet, honey like pale grain flavors are found up front, while the finish has an almost menthol like, herbaceous bitterness that makes this end with a very dry character; this is especially true when coupled with the typical, musty, sort of cotton ball like Dupont-yeast phenolics (that arent quite medicinal in character).  A biting bitterness is noticeable at times, but others sees the honey and pale malt sweetness being a bit stronger.  The beer is nicely light and quaffable and there is a lemon like flavor here as well as a nice grassy note.  This is quite a nice beer, it is very much Saison like, which I will certainly never complain about.

Le liquide dévoile une robe dorée.  La mousse blanche est tenace.  Une dentelle est observée.  Le nez est particulier et très lourd avec des herbes sèches et humides, des fleurs et des épices, du grain mielleux et des arômes acidulés.  Le goût est semblable : des saveurs mordantes de houblons se combinent avec une levure un peu folle, piquante et fruitée.  Quelques notes boisées sont ressenties.  En bouche, le liquide a un corps moyen avec une effervescence active et une texture qui me semble huileuse.  La finale apporte des notes fruitées et des notes amères somme toute asséchantes.  En résumé, bière singulière.

UPDATED: NOV 12, 2006 Any first impressions?
-A thin ring of foam stays atop the golden yellow.
-Cereal sweetness and coriander-led spicing are applauded by the bubblegum yeastiness.
-Honeyed cereals and biting alcohol satisfy even though complexity isnt reached.
-The prickly effervescence isnt as expansive as the usual Duponts.

What if you dig deeper?
-The dry, herbal spiciness fades to a whisper.
-The bubblegum character returns towards the end.
-Cork tends to mar the beers aroma after the bottles been sitting on its side for a few months.
-The spicy Dupont yeast signature is obvious, but isnt as eloquent as I have known it to be.
-An interesting creation, as is always the case with Dupont, but theyve achieved much better results in most of their other, stellar offerings.

Bottles; best before December 07.

75 cl bottle, bbe Apr 07. Lovely amber colour with a good haze; big, rich, rocky head. The aroma roughly follows the lines of Saison Dupont - herbs, citrus peel, a touch of marzipan; a bit more yeasty than the Saison, though. Velvety and round malty taste, light fruity (hint of mandarins); nicely balanced spicy aftertaste. Dense, reasonably carbonated body with an elegant alcoholic finish.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2008 Bottle.
Hazy golden coloured with a white head.
Aroma of fruits with herbal, spicy and yeasty notes.
Flavour of fruits and yeast with flowery and herbal notes.

Bottle: High carbonation, golden colour with a lasting white head. Coriander, yeast, allspice and mild fruits in the nose. Flavour is a little dissppointing due to a green-apple like flavour. Some pleasant malt notes, along with spiced pears. Alcohol shows quite prominantly.  Could be better.

Draft. Clear golden body. Small white head. Nose is fruity with bubblegum/candyish notes, light yeast, creamy malts, and light flowery aromas. Taste is yeasty and fruity but with some candy-like sweetness and light bitterness. Light spiciness through this and faint alcohol as well. The body of this one had a medium overall feel with moderate carbonation. Finishes with buttery malts, spices, ripe fruits (pears and banana), soft yeast, and sweet malts.
Draft.  The pour was cloudy with a large head.  Had a definite spicy aroma.  A little sweet taste with a little bitter kick.
[bottle from beers of europe] Pours a cloudy orangey colour with a huge white head. Aroma has lots of yeast, orange peel, clove. lively body, dry spicey finish.

2004 bottle. A seriously intresting beer, as it has the characteristics of so many different styles. Pours super carbonated, like this guy puts a shakenup duvel to shame as it overflows all over my carpet. Aroma hits honey and pine, with some malts sweet triple like smells coming too. Taste is a mix of alot of different things, honey and pine again, but cloves with a little alcohol kicking back, very easy to drink, considering the carbonation. A different beer, but maybe the flavours dont mix aswell as they maybe could.

Bottled. Hazy orange colour with sediments floating around, small white foamy head. Aroma is weak fruits with hints of alcohol. Fruits, wheat some spices and yeast are present in the flavour. Fruity, quite sweet finish. Wellbalanced.

Bottled 75cl (brewed by 07/2005)
Hazy orangy, lots of floating yeast, small white head. Alcoholic, yeasty, fruity, peppery. Medium-bodied. Spices stick out of there: cinnamon and clove maybe. A bit fruity and quite Christmasy. Interesting but not very enjoyable.

Bottled, vintage 2004. Large frothy head, fully lasting. Cumin in the aroma. Dry texture. Very distinct cardamon flavor with few herbs and some malty sweetness. A noble beer, yet one-dimensional (right definition!).

Bottled, 2004 vintage. Aroma is very malty with cardamon and a hint of lemon. Dark yellow color, white head, good lace. Sweet, cardomon, bitter, medium body. Technically very much ok but onedimensional.

Bottle. Hazy golden yellow, witha slim & steady white head. Aroma is sweet, fruity and spicey with honey. Flavour is very spicey, lots of fruit and particularly honey. Big alcohol hit in the finish, which warms on the way down. Medium bodied, highly carbonated. Interesting, but a bit rough around the edges.
Yellow, golden coloured one. First traditional ale Ive had. And it was a nice one. Unusual  balanced, therefor interesting taste. Spicy with a bit sweetness and bitterness.

If this is the stuff they drank in the Roman Empire (Cervesia is supposed to be Latin for beer), they did a good job! Cloudy golden brown color, medium off-white head. Aroma of yeast, grapes, wheat. Bit sweet and spicy taste, crisp, yeasty. Heavy on the stomach, not a session ale for me. Another fine brew by Dupont.

Bottle from Beers of Europe. Golden blond with rocky white head. Overpowering aroma of spices and honey, reflected in the taste, which is a little too sweet and honey laden for my palate. Interesting and unusual stuff, though.
Very yasty nose, along with various spices. Golden colored body, medium white head. Spciy flavor, malts and quite yeasty.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2007 (on bottle)This must be the extreme picture of the turm "barnyard", heavy, cardboardish, swetty and haylike aroma. No head and a hazy pale orange colour. Malted taste, barly all over, some kandis and a small vink of sourness in finish.
RERATING JAN.2007 FROM 3.2 TO 3.9.

Draft in Brugge.  Clear deep golden color with a creamy white head that left good lacing.  Yeasty sweet aroma, herby with chamomille, marjoram, hay and light floral hops.  Sweet and bready, more herbiness, yeast, pepper and a noticible alcohol bite.  Smooth, full body and creamy carbonation.
Amber colour with a large but soapy white head. Malty and yeasty aroma with a caramel sweetness. Malty and spicy flavor with flower notes and a dry finish.
Pours golden whit a great white head. Fruity, fresh aroma with notes of yeast. Taste is fruity, yeasty, sour, spicy. Very fresh beer, with a dry finish.

UPDATED: JUN 10, 2005 (Bottle 75 cl) Fully golden pilsner-color with a tall and very white head. Full, sweet with a distinguishable streak of the wheat-malt, which adds a typical, soft edge. As a type, I would say its a Saison or Tripel - but with wheat. Unusual. Very carbonated. 100503
ZBF 2005. Pours a hazy golden with a white head.  Aroma is sweet fruity. Taste is yeasty and fruity.
Draught. Peppery aroma. Quite cloudy, golden colour. Semi-stable, creamy white head. Flavour is mild but peppery with some spices and a little sweetness.

UPDATED: JAN 8, 2007 Zythos Beer Festival, Sint-Niklaas, Belgium 2005. Hazy golden colour with a white head. Sweet fruity aroma and a sweet yeasty fruity taste. Medium body and a light alcoholic finish. 7-3-5-3-13
Re-Rate: Bottle. Den Tatoverede Enke. Light hazy golden colour with a big white head. Sweet malty, spicy, fruity aroma and taste, smooth. Medium to full body with a light dry alcoholic finish.
Hazy golden coloured. Intersting spicy aroma. Also lots of spices in the flavour along woth some fruitiness.

Pours a foamy white head on a hazy orange golden body. Lots of fruit such as oranges, citrus and pineapple in the aroma. Mostly sweet with tones of Dupont yeast. Flavor is quite heavy like most of the beers from Dupont. Obvious Dupont yeast notes  along with hay and pineapple. Little alcohol in there also. A typical Dupont brew!

An unclear orange beer with a nice but disappearing white head. The aroma is spicy and extremely yeasty with the characteristic Dupont yeast and besides this the aroma also contains notes of oranges and coriander. The flavor is sweet yeasty with notes of spices, oranges leading up to a smooth dry end.

Pale golden colour. Sweet spicy aroma. Although the aroma is very sweet and herbal, almost like resiny hops, the flavour is very crisp and clean, with a nice refreshing bite. Comes on with a bit of sourness on the finish. Pretty good stuff. Bottled at Bedford Beer Festival 2004.

Bottled - Bedford Beer Festival.  75cl bottle shared with the gathering.  The real deal!  A copper coloured beer with a full aroma of spices, pepper and spearmint.  These aromas all come through into the taste in a massively enjoyable way.  Tha alcohol level gives it a great kick.  Sounds an odd mix of flavours and I can see why some people would find it odd, but to me this is a truly great, tasty, fully enjoyable experience.

Bottled at the Bedford Beer Festival 2004 (Wednesday Session).Golden appearence, frothy white head. Very interesting beer. Sweet, cough medicine like, ginger. Spicy, alcoholic. An aquired taste, but pretty good.
Hazy golden with nice head. Many different aroma and taste impressions; yeast, wheat, grass, lambic overtones, funny sweetness (ginger marmelade I think!?!). Strange brew!
Hazy blond color, creamy head. Very nice Strong Belgian Ale aroma, herbal. Quite dry, spicy taste, like a good Tripel, with a strong long bitterness.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2007 (Bottled, 0.75l) Hazy yellow-golden color with a small head. Dry, somewhat acidic aroma of orangey fruit, wheat, vanilla, honey and hops. Delicate vanilla floweriness with ginger and cinnamon-spiciness in the bitterish, neutral and slightly tart flavor. Medium-bodied, crisp, neutral and acidic, even astringent, quite refreshing, slightly sticky palate with foamy, but smooth carbonation. An excellent, balanced and tasty summer drink.
(Bottled, 0,75l, rated Feb 22, 2004, was 6-3-7-3-12=3.2) Lager color, gets hazier towards the end of bottle as the yeast hits in. Sour, yeasty aroma, a bit stuffed and metallic. Fruity, flowery, soapy flavor - fresh. Bitter finish. Carbonated, slightly stingy palate.

UPDATED: SEP 1, 2012 Bottle (2012).

Head is initially average sized, frothy/fizzy, off-white, mostly diminishing.
Body is hazy dark yellow, bottle conditioned.

Aroma is lightly to moderately malty (toasted grain, cookie), lightly hoppy (herbs, apricot), moderately yeasty (cobwebs), with notes of black pepper, eucalyptus, lavender, black tea, fennel seed, peach skin, coriander, earth, sage, gum.

Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, lightly to moderately bitter.
Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately acidic, moderately bitter.

Medium body, watery/velvety texture, lively carbonation, lightly alcoholic.

Tremendous aromatic depth and enticement...very spicy and herbal to the point that trying to pin down all the various components is a lost cause.  However...the nose isnt loud and obnoxious despite the unending list of aromatics it suggests.  It could be described as medicinal, I suppose, but its very attractive nonetheless.  In the mouth its insanely clean, balanced, and quaffable, and the 8% is scarcely to be found.  I hate to seem like a Dupont fanboy, but...well...this is pretty frickin good stuff.

(beer is made following an authentic/reconstructed spice recipe for ancient Celtic beverages) Golden, slight haze; small, but slowly diminishing rim of foam. Perfumed, even soapy nose, which is different from what I recall: much less spicey than it used to be. Quite some citrus. Peppery, and cookie (or bottom-of-pie) taste. Again, less spicey than remembered. I still can tell the paradise seed. Again perfumey in the finish. Medium to full bodied. Spicey aftertaste. What is it? Third beer in a row I used to like better. Is it me or the beer? This is still very good, however. One one ought to have tasted - if you can find it.

Lemon and grapefruit aroma. Very citric flavor, hoppy. A witbier character is present in this beer, but much dryer. A slight herbalness comes up after a while. Hopbitter finish with grapefruit. Great strong ale with a lot of character.
Bottle Conditioned. Shared with Duff & Nuffield. Clove. Cinnamon. Watery honey. Thin bodied. Alcohol humming around. Lacks character - apart from a strange toilet cleaner & vomit aroma.
defintely not worth the 6 bloody quid. Lots of menthol, citrus, some yeasty sourness. Some clove, toilet cleaner and vomit, fizzy and detergenty. bittersweet flavour (750ml bottle- ChelmsfordBF-03')

A 750 ml bottle shared by Duff, SilkTork, and myself at the 2003 Chelmsford Beer Festival.  A big white head leaped from the pour, rather attractively, but perhaps the life gets sucked out in this because the palate is hollower than the head would suggest.  The flavors are subtle--honey-like with a bit of clove--but subtlety and a lack of depth lay uncomfortably close, like the prince and the pauper in the graveyard.  At six quid for a bottle, we decided it wasn't worth it.
